intro: Gaudinopsis quercetorum, commonly known as the red-flowered gaudinopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive red petals and finely divided leaves, which are typical of the carrot family. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to certain regions of South America. Its flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained conditions.
